private_information: I can move disks A B C D E only.
A is the smallest disk and E is the largest disk I may move.
agent_1.goal: Rearrange the disks so that the left peg has (top->bottom) A E F G H I J, middle peg is empty, and right peg has (top->bottom) B C D.

private_information: I can move disks F G H I J only.
F is the smallest disk and J is the largest disk I may move.
agent_2.goal: Rearrange the disks so that the left peg has (top->bottom) A E F G H I J, middle peg is empty, and right peg has (top->bottom) B C D.

orchestrator.goal: Coordinate agent_1 and agent_2 so the group reaches the target Tower of Hanoi configuration and produce a PDDL encoding of the multi-agent task.

public_information: There are three pegs called left middle right.
There are 10 disks labeled A B C D E F G H I J where A is smallest and J is largest.
Initial configuration left peg top-to-bottom: A B C D E F G H I J. Middle peg is empty. Right peg is empty.
Goal configuration left peg top-to-bottom: A E F G H I J. Middle peg is empty. Right peg top-to-bottom: B C D.
Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk may be moved at a time and a larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Agent movement restrictions: agent_1 may only move disks A B C D E. Agent_2 may only move disks F G H I J.

plan_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You can move only disks A B C D E. Do not produce PDDL. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you are allowed to perform given the public information and the global goal. Each move must be formatted exactly as 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' where peg names are left middle or right. Follow Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk. Provide only moves you are allowed to perform and do not assume additional abilities.
plan_moves.prompt: You are agent_1. Public information: {environment->public_information} Your private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information} Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal} Think step by step and provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you can perform given your allowed disks. Format each line as 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. If some moves require actions by the other agent, list only the moves that you can perform now or later when valid under the rules.

plan_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You can move only disks F G H I J. Do not produce PDDL. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you are allowed to perform given the public information and the global goal. Each move must be formatted exactly as 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' where peg names are left middle or right. Follow Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk. Provide only moves you are allowed to perform and do not assume additional abilities.
plan_moves.prompt: You are agent_2. Public information: {environment->public_information} Your private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information} Global goal: {agents->agent_2->goal} Think step by step and provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you can perform given your allowed disks. Format each line as 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. If some moves require actions by the other agent, list only the moves that you can perform now or later when valid under the rules.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling targeting the FastDownwards solver. You will produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the two-agent Tower of Hanoi task and the given goal. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep the actions of agent_1 and agent_2 distinct by naming operators accordingly. Integrate the primitive move sequences provided by the agents into the model or use them to validate the produced encoding. Do not invent extra agent capabilities beyond their private information. The produced PDDL must be compatible with FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Public information: {environment->public_information} Agent 1 proposed moves: {moves_agent_1} Agent 2 proposed moves: {moves_agent_2} Global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Consider that agent_1 may only move A B C D E and agent_2 may only move F G H I J. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards that represents the multi-agent Tower of Hanoi task and the target configuration. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct.
